page.title: 19LONGCLIFFE ECOLOGY CENTRE
page.content: Our class visited the Ecology Centre on May 23rd. These are some of our observations. "Most interesting were the rhodo_ dendron hills. It was there that we saw huge sets which belonged to the badgers. We found the main entrance and some new holes." (Sarah) "I counted the spots on ladybirds. I saw some with ten and others with only two spots." (Samantha) "We measured some trees. The Scots Pine was nearly 22 m high and its girth was l l/2 m" (Abigail) "I enjoyed the uprooted tree. It was hidden by bushes and was lying on its side. It was higher than me and the roots were covered in clay"(John) "I found a centipede and a milli_ ped. I saw a millipede open its full length and I saw one in a little ball." (Matthew)
